item.title: Australia introduces regulations to prevent power companies from overcharging loyal customers; Fire reported at clothing warehouse in Sydney.
item.description:
**Headline:** New Energy Pricing Rules Introduced to Protect Consumers in Australia
**Summary:** The Australian Energy Market Commission (AEMC) has introduced new regulations to enhance consumer protection in the energy market. These rules will prevent energy retailers from increasing prices more than once a year for most customers and eliminate additional fees for vulnerable individuals. The measures aim to ensure consumers are not penalized for loyalty and are charged no more than the standing offer price if their plan changes or expires. By removing excessive penalties and restricting price hikes to once every 12 months, these reforms are designed to provide Australians with more secure and manageable energy plans, while offering necessary support to those in financial hardship.

item.description:
Headline: Parisian Green Party Member Pouria Amirshahi Denied Entry to the United States
Summary: Pouria Amirshahi, a Parisian parliamentarian and co-initiator of "La Digue," a project aimed at countering far-right movements, was unable to enter the United States. He had planned to engage in discussions with American lawmakers and civil society representatives.

item.title: A weather pattern is expected to increase temperatures and humidity across much of the United States.
item.description:
Headline: Upcoming Weather System to Raise Temperatures and Humidity in the US
Summary: The Midwest is expected to see temperatures in the 90s Fahrenheit (30s Celsius), with the East Coast also experiencing warmer weather. This week, a weather pattern known as a heat dome will introduce increased temperatures and humidity across a significant portion of the United States. The upcoming weekend is likely to bring particularly high temperatures in areas such as Nebraska, Illinois, Wisconsin, and Iowa. Weather experts advise residents to stay informed and take measures to stay cool and hydrated.

item.title: Watchdog advises careful use of pepper spray in youth prisons due to racial disparities in treatment, United States.
item.description:
Headline: Review Suggested for Pepper Spray Use in Youth Facilities Amid Concerns on Racial Impact, Says Watchdog
Summary: Head of monitoring boards encourages a review of the current implementation of Pava spray in youth institutions in England and Wales. Elisabeth Davies, national chair of the Independent Monitoring Boards, has proposed that justice secretary Shabana Mahmood consider pausing the use of Pava spray in these facilities. This suggestion aims to ensure that concerns about its use, especially in relation to the treatment of minority prisoners, are thoroughly addressed.

item.title: The United States introduces new visa requirements for foreign students to disclose social media profiles.
item.description: Headline: New US Visa Requirements Involve Reviewing Foreign Students' Social Media Summary: The U.S. State Department has introduced guidelines requiring foreign students to provide access to their social media profiles when applying for educational and exchange visas. This measure aims to identify any potential concerns related to attitudes toward American citizens, culture, government, or its founding principles. US diplomats will perform the reviews as part of the visa application process, ensuring applicants meet the outlined criteria.
